results.title: Touring Australia
results.creator_credit: Eddie Moses, John Richardson, Film Australia and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: An informative and entertaining film that combines an overall perspective of Australia with fascinating stories that relate to special places, individuals, events and recreational activities. These stories form the fabric of the film, stories about the historic Rocks area of Sydney, the Great Barrier Reef, the colourful Ghan railway, the mystical Ayers Rock and the world-famous Sydney Opera House. Touring Australia touches on Australia’s history - colonial heritage, the struggle for independence and unique position beside the states of Asia. It also shows the timelessness of its land mass, special animals and the blending of many cultures. We see the great modern cities of Australia, the enchanting wilderness places from Kakadu to the Top End.

results.title: Tough on two wheels
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Film Partnership
results.brief_description: Motor-cycles and the people who ride them, showing the variety of ways in which motor-cycles are used in Britain from everyday uses for business and pleasure to the thrills of the speedway and the Wall of Death. Includes sequences of the Isle of Man, T.T., Silverstone and the 1954 International Six Days Trial.

results.title: Tough at the top: business management styles
results.creator_credit: Robyn Holdsworth, Image Link and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This program features five short acted scenarios demonstrating different business management styles. Each situation is analysed and the likely outcomes of each management approach is examined. Also highlighted is the issue that each manager is different and that no manager uses only one of these styles - they adopt different styles based on the circumstances of each situation faced. Management styles discussed include: consultative; laissez-faire; autocratic; participative and persuasive. Video support notes included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness, his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Cast includes: Damien Walters - Captain Johnno Rebecca Sykes - Julie Michelle Fawdon - Kathleen Joe Petruzzi - Tony Written by Rob George, music by Stephen Matters. Rated G.

results.title: Touch and go
results.brief_description: The modern methods of teaching used in Malaya’s schools for the blind are doing much to lessen the handicaps of blindness. Young children grow in confidence as they learn new skills such as basket making and reading braille. Older students are seen using braille typewriters and operating the special telephone switchboard made by the Malayan Telecommunications Department.

results.title: Total fitness in 30 minutes a week
results.brief_description: A simple, thirty-minute-a week program for achieving physical fitness is outlined and demonstrated by Dr Laurence Morehouse and journalist Leonard Gross. The film is very specific in its training techniques for achieving total fitness. The teaching methods are direct and easy to follow

results.title: Tosca
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler, John Copley and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House in 1985 this lavish production of Puccini’s opera stars Eva Marton as Tosca, Lamberto Furlan as her lover Cavaradossi and John Shaw as the villainous Baron Scarpia. Puccini’s tale of jealousy, love and betrayal is set against a background of the Napoleonic wars, brought vividly to life by Allan Lee’s superlative sets and John Copley’s outstanding production. The Australian Opera and Chorus is conducted by Alberto Erede.

results.title: Torque about a crisis a torque special
results.brief_description: An ABC “Torque” special featuring Peter Wherrett in which he demonstrates that motorists can save on fuel consumption by adopting certain driver practices.
